title: Refinery29 Loves: Everything To See & Shop In November
description: Welcome to Refinery29 Loves, the monthly news bulletin where you’ll find the best things to shop and see in fashion and beauty right now.With our Halloween outfits and vampy makeup locked away for another year, our heads are now firmly turning towards the practical parts of our wardrobe that work for all weather eventualities. Think striped sweaters, blanket scarves, and heavy-duty boots. But staying warm doesn’t mean dressing like you’re about to climb a mountain.This season, plenty of It Girls are inspiring our freezing fashion looks for the winter months ahead. For those seeking a chic and refined look, the Olsen twins remain superior thanks to their arsenal of tailored coats, turtlenecks, and classic loafers. If you want a cozier option, Katie Holmes is an ideal reference point for slouchy cardigans, well-fitting jeans, and low-heeled leather boots. A more elevated approach would be Taylor Russell, our inspo for all-out cold-girl glamor with caramel-colored coats, faux fur scarves, and gold statement jewelry. Then there’s makeup, and it’s safe to say that we’re embracing all things warm and glossy. Hailey Bieber is leading the mood board with a pumpkin spice-inspired lip and glowy peach cheeks. And for hair makeovers, we can’t take our eyes off Rihanna’s curls, dyed a very seasonal shade of autumn leaf. To uncover all the new fashion and beauty launches that are giving us even more inspiration this November, click through the slideshow ahead…Disney x Lululemon Good vibes await courtesy of the new Disney x Lululemon collab, which finds your favorite comfy pieces from the activewear brand adorned with playful Mickey Mouse motifs. The Happily Ever After collection includes Disney-fied versions of the cult-loved Align leggings, an oversized fleece hoodie, a bright pink Energy Longline sports bra, the viral Everywhere Belt Bag, a textured bucket hat with Mickey ears, and so much more. Prices range from $34 to $158.Shop now at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Warm Revelation Beanie, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Fleece Oversized Hoodie, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Everywhere Belt Bag 1L Mickey Outline Graphic, $, available at LululemonDisney x Lululemon Align™ High-Rise Pant 25", $, available at LululemonRhode Barrier ButterIt seems everything Hailey Bieber touches turns to gold, but how about butter? Rhode made its name with hydrating milks and peptide lip balms and now the brand has launched its thickest formula yet in the form of the Barrier Butter. An intensive moisturizer, the balm-like formula provides deep hydration for plump and glowing skin. Containing hyaluronic and polyglutamic acid, the buttery nighttime cream is all about locking in moisture and improving barrier function — perfect for chapped winter skin.Shop now at RhodeRhode Barrier Butter, $, available at RhodeFree People x Yellowstone With the Western trend still going strong, it only makes sense that Free People has partnered with the hit TV show Yellowstone for a limited-edition collection. The eight-piece We The Free capsule is full of Americana staples, including cowboy boots, bandanas, a cowboy hat, bootcut jeans, a suede jacket, and a graphic “Dutton Ranch” T-shirt with horses on it. Naturally, the campaign stars Yellowstone’s Kelsey Asbille and was shot on Dutton Ranch in Montana, where the Paramount+ series is filmed. The Free People x Yellowstone collection is available now, with prices ranging from $58 to $498.Shop now at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Dutton Tee, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Birch Belt, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Flora Low-Rise Bootcut Jeans, $, available at Free PeopleFree People x Yellowstone Allistar Pointed Boots, $, available at Free People& Other Stories Fall Savoir CollectionA limited-edition seasonal collection, Savoir showcases the work of & Other Stories' atelier with a capsule of designer-inspired fashion. Embracing all things texture, the drop includes a series of metallic jacquard looks, including a tailored longline coat, a sculptural peplum top, tapered suit trousers, and a brocade evening bag. If shimmering gold isn’t your thing, the collection includes softer looks, too, with a mint ruffled gown; pearl-adorned, baby blue pumps; and a belted black blazer, ready for party season.Shop now at & Other Stories& Other Stories Ruffled Chiffon Midi Dress, $, available at & Other StoriesNoah x BarbourAfter a successful run, British heritage brand Barbour and NYC menswear label Noah have reunited for another collaboration, this one made up of three fall- and winter-ready jackets. For the collection, the Noah team dug into Barbour’s archives and reimagined popular styles from the ’80s. There’s the unisex Wool Bedale Jacket, which features a corduroy collar and is made with Casentino wool (a fuzzy fabric dating back to the 14th century); the Cotton Bedale, with the same silhouette but in a salt-washed cotton canvas; and the Border Jacket, a longer tweed style. “For this season’s Barbour collection, we stuck to the classic jacket shapes we’ve always loved from them,” Noah founder Brendon Babenzien said in a press release. “Barbour jackets, more than any other, have a timeless quality that allows them to get passed down from one generation to the next.” The Noah x Barbour collab is available to shop now.Shop now at Noah and BarbourNoah x Barbour Wool Teddy Bedale Jacket, $, available at NoahMerit Retrospect Extrait de ParfumMerit is well loved for its beautifully crafted makeup products and now the brand is expanding into the fragrance space with a vanilla and crisp pear perfume. Encased in a sculptural gold-topped bottle, the debut perfume has top notes of bergamot, heart notes of rosemary and jasmine, and base notes of moss and musk. Formulated as a highly concentrated extrait de parfum (with almost 30% fragrance oil), the scent promises a long wear of over 12 hours.Shop now at Merit BeautyMerit Retrospect L’Extrait de Parfum, $, available at MeritRouje x MissomaIn a romantic collaboration of Paris and London design, the new Rouje x Missoma jewelry collection is a color-lover’s dream. Our favorite looks in the capsule include a pair of ‘80s-inspired, oversized mosaic studs combining semi-precious blue, red, and green quartz with 18-carat recycled gold plating. The playful designs continue with a molten heart necklace featuring three gemstones on a velvet black choker. If you prefer to keep things classic, the collab includes a chunky gold domed ring with ridged detailing and matching vintage-inspired hoops.Shop now at MissomaRouje x Missoma Marisa Heart Pearl Stud Earrings, $, available at MissomaRixo Launches HomewareKnown for its retro aesthetic and vintage-inspired prints, fashion brand Rixo is taking the next step in its stylistic journey with the launch of its homeware range, Casa Rixo. Featuring abstract printed tablecloths, cushions, and napkins, the collection is available in two distinct colorways: a warm, Mediterranean-inspired terracotta and a blue-hued design with olive and peach accents. Made from linen and cotton blends, the statement homeware is R29 dinner party-approved.Shop now at RixoRIXO Zebe Linen and Cotton-Blend Tablecloth, $, available at RixoKate Somerville Goat Milk Body Lotion Sold as a duo with the iconic Goat Milk facial cleanser, the latest launch from Kate Somerville is a soothing body lotion. Famous for its ability to quench dry and sensitive skin instantly, the goat milk-based cream feels lightweight but is packed with proteins for deep nourishment. Alongside the star ingredient goat milk, it includes moisturizing jojoba and avocado oils, calming shea butter and Manuka honey (an ingredient believed to alleviate dry skin conditions like dermatitis). Shop now at Kate SomervilleKate Somerville Stressed Skin Saviors, $, available at Kate SomervilleMarc Jacobs x Wizard of OzThe arrival of Wicked on the big screen has us all reaching for emerald green attire or a fluffy pink ballgown, but Marc Jacobs is offering something a tad more sophisticated to coincide with the film’s release. Taking inspiration from the original Wizard of Oz, the collection includes totes, handbags and wallets with stills from the iconic movie, including imagery of the famed yellow brick road. For the biggest Dorothy fans around, the main event is a pair of diamanté-encrusted, crimson Mary Janes with a vertigo-inducing platform heel that makes the original ruby slippers look like running shoes.Shop now at Marc JacobsMarc Jacobs x The Wizard of Oz The Friends of Dorothy Leather Mini Compact Wallet, $, available at Marc JacobsHuda Beauty Icy Nude CollectionWith icy days on the horizon, we’ve got nothing but love for Huda Beauty’s latest frosty collection of cool-toned colors. Announced as the brand’s last foray into big eyeshadow palettes, the shades include a mix of mauve alongside a gunmetal glitter, pink shimmer and a snow-white matte. Branching beyond palettes, the collection also includes three new Faux Filter lipglosses (including an icy iridescent clear) and a ‘frostbitten’ face gloss that changes color with the pH of the skin. If frosty hues aren’t your thing, you can warm up with two new Blush Filters in deep Coco Loco and Latte.Shop now at Huda Beauty Huda Beauty Icy Nude Eyeshadow Palette, $, available at Huda BeautyLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Refinery29 Loves: Everything To Shop In OctoberMango's Fall Collection Is As Trendy As It GetsShop Stanley x LoveShackFancy Collab Water Bottles
author: Alicia Lansom

title: The Only Gift Guide You Need For All The Curly Girlies In Your Life
description: As a curly girl with coarse, dry, 3C strands, I always struggled to find products that did anything positive for my hair. Trust me, the Mufasa mane was real any time I would try your typical run-of-the-mill salon brand — it just didn’t work. Unfortunately, many other Black women tell me they’ve had similar experiences and that it’s frustrating trying to find what truly works for coarser hair textures. Enter: SheaMoisture. I’d honestly given up hope until I wandered into my local Target one day and decided to pick up a few products from the brand. I’d heard only positive things about it from my fellow curlies because it’s affordable and the formulas *actually* work. SheaMoisture products are designed with my hair type in mind — curly and coily textures that need more hydration than average to remain soft, frizz-free, and easy to manage.Another thing you should know about my hair is that I have a lot of it, so if I use the wrong products, things can go south very quickly. This made me skeptical at first to try anything new, but I decided to give the brand’s Manuka Honey & Yogurt Hydrate + Repair Treatment a go along with the leave-in. I was impressed. The two treatments are staples of mine to this day and I use them weekly. They both keep my hair so soft, tangle-free, shiny, and hydrated. I couldn’t ask for a better duo.Needless to say, I’d finally found relief and now that the holiday season has rolled around, I can now share this gift of next-level hair with someone else. If you have a friend or family member with a similar hair type, I’m here to provide your SheaMoisture gift guide featuring every key product they’ll love. Anyone whose hair is their pride and glory won’t be disappointed — including yourself if you’re looking to snag yourself a holiday treat. For everything I’m gifting from the brand this season, take a look ahead.Bond Repair Leave-In ConditionerFor anyone on your list who’s dealing with dryness, split ends, breakage, or chemical damage, SheaMoisture’s Bond Repair Leave-In Conditioner is just the ticket. It’s infused with amla oil, a restorative HydroPlex infusion, shea butter, and an amino acid blend that provides some serious TLC when it comes to hydration. On wet hair, it provides 12 times more moisture than normal and eight times more on dry hair. Detangling and smoothing curly and coily textures is a breeze when you use it and it even assists with humidity control.SheaMoisture Bond Repair Leave-In Conditioner, $, available at WalmartBonding OilIf your best friend happens to heat style daily, then this Bonding Oil is a must. It’s super lightweight but contains hydration heavy-hitters similar to the leave-in (shea butter and amla oil). The addition of sunflower, castor, and grapeseed oils in this formula, though, really helps lock in moisture and seal the hair cuticle against styling damage. Flyaways are also no match for it with 24-hour frizz control.SheaMoisture Bonding Oil, $, available at WalmartBond Repair ShampooOkay — you caught me. I’ll be buying this Bond Repair Shampoo for myself because it’s perfect for my hair type. It’s formulated for curl and coil types three and four and contains the brand’s unique amino acid blend. This ensures that the hair retains 60% more moisture and removes buildup without stripping it of its natural oils. SheaMoisture Bond Repair Shampoo, $, available at WalmartBond Repair ConditionerI have several family members who relaxed their hair recently and didn’t love the results (it left their strands damaged), so I know this conditioner will be perfect for them. It’s part of the brand’s four-step repair system along with the other Bond Repair collection items I mentioned. It really adds that extra moisture and softness to strands that are coarse or brittle while working to repair broken hair bonds. As a bonus, it’s also great for protective styles.SheaMoisture Bond Repair Conditioner, $, available at WalmartCoconut & Hibiscus Curl-Enhancing SmoothieThis is a classic SheaMoisture favorite that I loved when I started my natural hair journey because it’s perfect for leaving my thick curls defined. If you have a sibling with a similar hair type as you, don’t hesitate to buy it for them this holiday season. It’s packed with super hydrators like neem oil, coconut oil, and silk protein — a winning trio for dry, coarse curl types.SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl-Enhancing Smoothie, $, available at WalmartCoconut & Hibiscus Frizz-Free Curl MousseI know you have curly-haired friends who complain about the crunchiness that comes with using gel for definition. This gift will be their new holy grail because it completely solves that issue. The super lightweight, airy texture enhances natural curls and waves without weighing them down while adding much needed shine and volume.SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Frizz-Free Curl Mousse, $, available at WalmartCoconut & Hibiscus Smooth & Shine OilAccording to my friends who only wear protective styles, this lightweight oil is the GOAT. It helps keep baby hairs in place and adds shine without making your hair look greasy. Obviously, I’ll be buying quite a few this holiday season to fully stock them up.SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Smooth & Shine Oil, $, available at WalmartRosemary & Collagen Strengthening Scalp & Hair OilThis Rosemary & Collagen Strengthening Oil makes a great stocking stuffer for someone dealing with breakage or anyone who wants to promote healthy hair growth. Rosemary leaf oil is known to encourage length retention and this lightweight formula contains other hydration heroes like castor oil, soybean oil, and shea butter for healthier strands.SheaMoisture Rosemary & Collagen Strengthening Scalp & Hair Oil, $, available at WalmartLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

title: Face-Framing Layers Can Completely Transform Your Haircut
description: One way to spice up any old haircut is with layers. Whether you have a U-shaped haircut or a classic bob, adding layers instantly makes the style feel fresh and new. It's important to note: not all layers are the same - it's more of a category, similar to how there's not one style of bangs. Some add volume, others remove weight, and then there are those that surround your face like a picture, drawing attention to your best features. Those are called face-framing layers. Even the classification of face-framing layers is vast, and there are several factors that can influence the final look. Different haircuts, hair types, and face shapes call for a slightly different approach. That's why it's imperative that you see a professional for this type of cut. Face-framing layers should be tailored to the wearer and when done correctly, have the power to completely change your hairstyle - even if you barely alter the style itself. What Are Face-Framing Layers? Face-framing layers simply border the face. They can be long and seamlessly blended, making them barely noticeable, or they can be short and choppy to make a big statement. Bangs don't always come attached to layers, but they are a great addition. For example, curtain bangs mimic the effect of face-framing layers, but they're shorter, reaching only cheekbone length. To differentiate true layers from bangs, they need to be longer. Many of the popular haircut trends of today are all about layering. This includes the shag, "wolf cut," cub cut, and C-shape haircut, to list just a few. Face-framing layers can help remove weight from the front of your hair, adding more body and movement or, on the other hand, make your hair look fuller by adding texture. Most of all, they're very flattering and can accentuate your eyes, cheekbones, and jawline, depending on the length. Ahead, see different examples of face-framing layers to inspire your next haircut appointment.
author: Jessica Harrington

title: 16 Makeup Gift Sets Recommended by Pros and Editors
description: You still have a little bit of time before the holidays are officially here, but it's never too early to get a head start on your gift buying. Sifting through all of the sales and options can be kind of a snooze, especially if you aren't quite sure what to get everyone on your list. If you still haven't quite decided on the perfect present for the beauty aficionado in your life, trust us when we say you can't go wrong with a makeup gift set. Gifts for makeup lovers can be hard to decide on because there are so many fun options to choose from, but fortunately for you, we have the perfect solution. In an effort to make your holiday shopping as smooth and seamless as possible, we reached out to a few of our most trusted makeup experts and asked them for their top makeup gift set picks, and their answers did not disappoint. Just to make sure we covered all of our bases, we also asked editors for their input as well. The result? Probably the most perfectly curated gift idea list, maybe ever. If you're looking for the perfect beauty gift to give (or receive!), you'll find something for everyone on your list, no matter how hard they are to shop for. Ahead, keep scrolling to check out the best makeup gift sets and more. Experts Featured in This Article Avery Golson is a makeup artist known for working with celebrities like Jasmine Sanders and Eve. Monica Alvarez is a makeup artist based in Los Angeles, New York, and Paris. She is known for working on editorial campaigns with brands like Alexis Bittar. Lyndsay Zavitz is a celebrity makeup artist based in Los Angeles. She is known for working with celebrities like Candace Cameron Bure. Miguel Lledo is a makeup artist known for doing editorial work with brands like Bottega Veneta.
author: Renee Rodriguez
